column1: There is a slight risk of complications with angioplasty and cardiac catheterization.

In general, risks may include: - Allergic reaction to any dye used during the test, to the stent material, or to the drug used in a drug-eluting stent - Bleeding or clotting in the area where the catheter was inserted - Blood clot - Clogging of the inside of the stent (in-stent restenosis) - Complete blockage of blood flow in a certain area - Damage to a heart valve or blood vessel - Heart attack - Irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) - Kidney failure (a higher risk in people who already have kidney problems or diabetes) - Stroke (this is rare)
If IVUS was done during cardiac catheterization, you will stay in the hospital for about 3 to 6 hours.
